revised_title: Unifying and Generalizing the Real and Complex Geometric Phases
tldr: The authors unify and generalize existing definitions of the real and complex geometric phases in a geometric perspective. They propose new formulae for both phases, which are applicable regardless of the nature or form of the equations of motion. The real geometric phase is defined as a functional on the set of all cyclic paths, while the complex geometric phase is defined as a functional on the set of all pairs of cyclic paths. The authors show that these phases are in general completely independent of each other.
